docs.snippet: LAKE SUCCESS, May 31 -- The United Nations Subcommission on Freedom of Information and of the Press was urged today to focus its attention on examining the "adequacy of news" now available throughout the world.

byline.original: Special to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: The world oil markets, which have been in the hands of United States corporations since the inception of the industry, definitely are passing to British interests, according to leading executives in the international end of operations. The trend was...
docs.lead_paragraph: The world oil markets, which have been in the hands of United States corporations since the inception of the industry, definitely are passing to British interests, according to leading executives in the international end of operations. The trend was emphasized last week when the British Government concluded an agreement to supply the petroleum needs of Argentina for the next five years.
docs.abstract: Signs of US losing control of world markets to GB discussed; indus officials score ERP aid to GB; cite increased Brit role in Sweden after Govt cut in available dollars for oil imports; Near East output also seen threat to US

headline.main: U. S. IS SEEN LOSING WORLD OIL MARTS; Trend Toward British Grip Is Noted in Nation's Pact to Supply Argentina

docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES -- North American tourists setting out for their first trip to South America will do well to spend an evening studying the map of the exciting continent they plan to explore. Such study may dispel some of their illusions, but those are...
docs.lead_paragraph: BUENOS AIRES -- North American tourists setting out for their first trip to South America will do well to spend an evening studying the map of the exciting continent they plan to explore. Such study may dispel some of their illusions, but those are well lost; a little knowledge of this part of the Western Hemisphere is essential to a good vacation here.

headline.main: A VAST CONTINENT; South America Defies the Hit-Run Tourist With Its Size and Great Diversity

docs.snippet: Rumor, followed by denial, and repeating the maneuver several times over with respect to the devaluation of the pound sterling last week left bankers and dealers in the foreign exchanges as much in the dark of its imminence or probability as has...
docs.lead_paragraph: Rumor, followed by denial, and repeating the maneuver several times over with respect to the devaluation of the pound sterling last week left bankers and dealers in the foreign exchanges as much in the dark of its imminence or probability as has centered in this topic since first bruited about two years ago.

headline.main: FOREIGN EXCHANGE RATES; Week Ended June 3, 1949.

docs.snippet: At a time when such genuinely important foreign policies as the Atlantic Treaty and the Hull Trade Agreements program demand the country's serious attention it is unfortunate, to put it mildly, that such unrealistic schemes as the so-called...
docs.lead_paragraph: At a time when such genuinely important foreign policies as the Atlantic Treaty and the Hull Trade Agreements program demand the country's serious attention it is unfortunate, to put it mildly, that such unrealistic schemes as the so-called international wheat agreement should be permitted to force their way onto the same stage and share at least a part of the spotlight.

docs.snippet: LAKE SUCCESS, June 8 -- A move by the smaller nations to enable private persons and groups to complain to the United Nations against alleged violations of their fundamental freedoms was rejected today by the Commission on Human Rights.

docs.snippet: THE last year or two in the exhibition field has been productive of an unusually large number of stimulating retrospective exhibitions. If, as one of Lowes Dickinson's characters in "A Modern Symposium" asserted, "the first sign of a step forward is...
docs.lead_paragraph: THE last year or two in the exhibition field has been productive of an unusually large number of stimulating retrospective exhibitions. If, as one of Lowes Dickinson's characters in "A Modern Symposium" asserted, "the first sign of a step forward is a look backward," then the exhibitions of the period have been especially significant.

headline.main: CHIEFLY MODERN; Modern Museum's Prints -- Groups in Contrast

docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES, June 11 -- Relations between Argentina and Uruguay, which have been fretful for many months, again were jarred last night when the Foreign Office rejected a request by Uruguay for a safe conduct for Argentine Opposition Deputy Augustin...
docs.lead_paragraph: BUENOS AIRES, June 11 -- Relations between Argentina and Uruguay, which have been fretful for many months, again were jarred last night when the Foreign Office rejected a request by Uruguay for a safe conduct for Argentine Opposition Deputy Augustin Rodriguez Araya, who took refuge in the Uruguayan Embassy Thursday after having been outed by the Peronista majority.
docs.abstract: flies to Montevideo after having taken refuge in Uruguayan Embassy

headline.main: ANTI-PERSON DEPUTY IN URUGUAY HAVEN; Ousted Legislator Is Permitted to Leave Argentina After Asylum at Embassy
